page.title: 05TOPSHAM CHURCHES
page.content: Topsham has two chapels by the cemetary at Sunhill Avenue, and four churches: St. Margaret's (Church of England), St. Nicholas' (Methodist), The Church of the Holy Cross (Catholic), and a congregational church in Victoria road. From St. Margaret's church tower you can see across the river Exe to Exminster. In the churchyard are buried some of the crew of HMS Victory. The church is built in the shape of a cross and has had parts added over the years. The tower is built of sandstone and the clock was put in for the Queen's diamond jubilee in 1897. One of the corner stones was laid on December 9th 1874 by Sir J.T.B. Duckworth. A memorial stone remembers 23 Topsham people who died in the first world war and 39 people from the second world war.
